skillTree.localised_description: A fine horse bred in the Grey Mountains.

skillTree.localised_description: A majestic pegasus imported from Bretonnia.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
The Von Mackensen's have a long tradition in fortress warfare, spending more time within stone walls than outside.

skillTree.localised_description: The Margrave has the highest of ambitions, the kind that reaches to the very heart of Altdorf.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Mackensen's finest men serve on the rampards of Helmgart, a fortress that has withstood siege countless of times.
He who has the Key to Helmgart holds the acesss to vital trade routes.
It is not Karl, it is I, Reinhardt - that is best suited to lead the Empire.
The trick to defending a fortress is not the walls, it's the barrage aimed from behind the walls at any unlucky foe.

effects.description:
Leadership: +8 when laying siege or encircling
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Mortar, Culverins, Ship's Cannon, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mackensen plots to take over the very power over not just Helmgart, but the Empire entirely.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: Behind his rebellious mask hides a much more sinister plot..
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

factionEffects.localised_description: Fort-Commander Frankenwurter leads a rebellion against the coronated Karl Franz

items.colour_text: The Von Mackensen's have ruled the Grey Mountains for generations, their name revered throughout the entire pass. The Margraves that stem from this Noble family have held the Mountain Valley against numerous threats for decades. Expertly training the Fortress Garrison to operate both in siege warfare and in the rugged mountain climate. The garrison's elite proudly bears the Von Mackensen banner.

Originally the Watch Captain of Ubersreik, Holz was drafted to serve as Captain Guard in the Fortress of Helmgart. Holz is a bear of a man unfased by the cold climate of the Grey Mountains and has faced all kinds of threats in the melting pot that is Ubersreik. His presence on the Fortress Walls inspire the brethren facing any foe daring enough to climb their final fate.

Passed on from Margrave to Margrave, Helmgart's Brand is the token worn by the Lord-Warden of the Grey Mountains. Forged by the Dwarfs of Karak Zorn it is enchanted with magical essence, hence why it's hilt always remains warm and pleasant to handle - regardless of the terrain the sword finds itself in. Making it easy for any wielder to fight regardless of the climate.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Lord-Warden of the Empire holds the key to the Grey Mountains and the lands beyond.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -25% during siege battles
	(Lord's army)
